findings.title: Integer overflow in depositsCount
findings.explanation: The depositsCount state variable is incremented without any overflow checks. If depositsCount reaches the maximum uint value (2^256-1), it will wrap around to zero, leading to incorrect accounting.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use a checked arithmetic library like SafeMath for incrementing depositsCount, e.g., depositsCount = depositsCount.add(1), or explicitly check that depositsCount + 1 > depositsCount before incrementing.

findings.title: Unchecked external call in sendMoney allowing reentrancy
findings.explanation: The sendMoney function uses a low-level call (`_target.call.value(_value)()`) without checking the return value. This forwards all remaining gas and can allow a malicious contract to re-enter this contract, potentially causing unexpected behavior if state changes are added later.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use the checks-effects-interactions pattern: update all state before making external calls, or use `transfer` which limits gas, and always check the return value of low-level calls. For example, `require(_target.call.value(_value)())`.

unmatched_predictions.title: Unchecked external call in sendMoney allowing reentrancy
